t: Proverbs 18
Whoever*pn isolates himself seeks his own desire; he*ld breaks out against all sound judgment.
A*ln fool takes no pleasure in understanding, but*ld only in expressing his opinion.
When*ln wickedness comes, contempt comes also, and*ld with dishonor comes disgrace.
The*ln words of a man’s mouth are deep waters; the*ld fountain of wisdom is a bubbling brook.
It*ln is not good to be partial to the wicked or*ld to deprive the righteous of justice.
A*ln fool’s lips walk into a fight, and*ld his mouth invites a beating.
A*ln fool’s mouth is his ruin, and*ld his lips are a snare to his soul.
The*ln words of a whisperer are like delicious morsels; they*ld go down into the inner parts of the body.
Whoever*ln is slack in his work is*ld a brother to him who destroys.
The*ln name of the Lord*s is a strong tower; the*ld righteous man runs into it and is safe.
A*ln rich man’s wealth is his strong city, and*ld like a high wall in his imagination.
Before*ln destruction a man’s heart is haughty, but*ld humility comes before honor.
If*ln one gives an answer before he hears, it*ld is his folly and shame.
A*ln man’s spirit will endure sickness, but*ld a crushed spirit who can bear?
An*ln intelligent heart acquires knowledge, and*ld the ear of the wise seeks knowledge.
A*ln man’s gift makes room for him and*ld brings him before the great.
The*ln one who states his case first seems right, until*ld the other comes and examines him.
The*ln lot puts an end to quarrels and*ld decides between powerful contenders.
A*ln brother offended is more unyielding than a strong city, and*ld quarreling is like the bars of a castle.
From*ln the fruit of a man’s mouth his stomach is satisfied; he*ld is satisfied by the yield of his lips.
Death*ln and life are in the power of the tongue, and*ld those who love it will eat its fruits.
He*ln who finds a wife finds a good thing and*ld obtains favor from the Lord.*s
The*ln poor use entreaties, but*ld the rich answer roughly.
A*ln man of many companions may come to ruin, but*ld there is a friend who sticks closer than a brother.
